qas.question: Goddard collected mainly what type of Buddhist scripture?
Dr. Babasaheb Ambedkar attempted to create a single combined document with all Buddhist principles and called it?

context: Dwight Goddard collected a sample of Buddhist scriptures, with the emphasis on <a0_0>Zen<a0_0/>, along with other classics of Eastern philosophy, such as the Tao Te Ching, into his 'Buddhist Bible' in the 1920s. More recently, Dr. Babasaheb Ambedkar attempted to create a single, combined document of Buddhist principles in "<a1_0>The Buddha and His Dhamma<a1_0/>". Other such efforts have persisted to present day, but currently there is no single text that represents all Buddhist traditions.
